text:
Randy and Jenny Boyd are providing a $5.6 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd School of Journalism and Electronic Media at the University of Tennessee.
The school, be housed in the College of Communication and Information and will offer undergraduate degrees in journalism and electronic media, with courses focusing on print, broadcast and online media.
The Boyds' gift is one of the largest in UT's history, and it brings the total of their contributions to the university to more than $10 million.
"We are deeply grateful for Randy and Jenny's generosity and commitment to the University of Tennessee," said UT President Joe DiPietro. "Their gift will have a transformative impact on our students and faculty in the College of Communication and Information."
The school will be led by Dr. Mark Littman, who has been named the inaugural director. He comes from Ohio University, where he served as director of the E.W. Scripps School of Journalism.
"Jenny and I are thrilled to support the University of Tennessee in this way," Randy Boyd said. "We believe that journalism plays a critical role in our democracy, and we want to help train the next generation of journalists to tell the stories that need to be told."
Jenny Boyd added, "We're excited about the opportunities this school will provide for students in Tennessee and beyond.
